Infrastructure Systems Project Management OfficeProgram and Project managed the implementation of high profile infrastructure development efforts.  Primary responsibilities include strengthening our security posture through implementation of standard security methodology and processes throughout the organization to gain efficiency in security operational practices.  Implementation of Project Management processes to mature the Infrastructure Project Management Office.Program Managed the implementation of CA Privilege Access Control across 10,000 distributed systems to limit systems access to job role with traceability and ongoing compliance verification; Managed vendor negotiations, resources, and a $5 million budgetProgram Managed Network Segmentation multi-year efforto	Implemented separate network zones to isolate and restrict application data flows to over 450 application through the implementation of firewalls and enhanced IDS’s (MacAfee Intrusion Detection Systems)o	Implemented two factor authentication using VeriSign through a jump host to provide an additional layer of authentication for administrative access to the production environmentImplemented 802.1x Network Access Controls across 232 branches, 106 satellite facilities, and 25 service centers globally to restrict only authorized computing devices on the Schwab network using Juniper infrastructure and Great Bay SoftwareImplemented MacAfee desktop encryption using SafeBoot software to over 1000 laptops Implemented HP ArcSight Security Information and Event Manager solution for logging security alerts generated by network hardware and applications, and generate reports for compliance purposesCollaborated with PMO peers to standardize project artifacts such as Project Workflows, SOW, Requirements, Closing Traceability, and Project Schedules

Program and Project Manager for the global technical development and implementation of the test case management, automation, and performance testing tools.  Implemented test tool initiatives within scope, schedule, and budget that contributed to $40M reengineering savings.  TQO finance manager for a $28M budget and a $5M technical development budget for a team of 55.  Concurrently, managed vendor relationships with outsource contract firms and Mercury/HP.    Managed and provided direction to technicians.Managed global deployment of Mercury/HP QuickTest Professional tool, which reduced testing time, increased test coverage and reduced errorsSpearheaded the Quality Center implementation resulting in re-usability, traceability, project tracking and metrics gatheringLed Performance Center implementation, which resulted in more efficient operating systemsGlobally integrated Mercury/HP standard testing tools into testing and development processes to 10,000+ usersDeveloped and Implemented Testing Metrics Strategy resulting in improved global reportingNegotiated and developed Mercury/HP Vendor Relationship roles and responsibilities for Statement of Work; Provided day to day leadership for customer servicing; Reengineered team development processes to improve upgrades and enhancementsConducted multiple initiatives’ program and portfolio requirement discussions analyzing, prioritizing, and providing final implementation recommendations that meet viable business alternatives to client challenges and opportunities based on feasibility, risk, timing, and organizational impactDeveloped and facilitated global monthly testing information shares resulting in increased adoption rate of testing tools at the technical, programmer, and analyst levels.  Delivered and provided coaching to team members through the development of testing tool user guides, best practices, and a data dictionary

Analyzed, recommended, and implemented viable marketing business alternatives to client challenges and opportunities based on feasibility, risk, timing, and organizational impact using appropriate methodology to fulfill stated objectives in support of company policies and procedures.  Managed and provided direction to technicians.Implemented List Execution Transformation web based marketing campaign management execution data repository leveraging Cognos, a 3rd party vendor tool

Analyzed, recommended, and implemented business partner requirements utilizing the correct methodologies to achieve coordination of activities during project development life cycles in support of International Accounts Payable and Marketing TechnologyImplemented the Analytical and Execution Platform moving our technical infrastructure from hierarchical to a relational database platform Produced procedures for cross training, document repository, and project trackingChairman’s Award for Quality:  Global Account Payables History Accumulation Performance Enhancements, which reduced cost of CPU cycles by 27% and storage space by 81% (62 million database rows)

Yolanda is a very loyal and committed individual.  My experience with Yolanda when we worked together at American Express was extremely positive.  She dives in, and takes the initiative to do the best of her ability.  She doesn't wait for direction, she need little to get her going.  She is accountable and holds others to their commitments.  I would love to have her on my team, as a leader, or as a direct report.  She is a great worker and is capable of being a great leader.
